item.title: Do You Need Battlefield 6 To Play REDSEC? How To Play Battlefield REDSEC Battle Royale
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield REDSEC offers several new ways to play Battlefield 6. It arrived after Battlefield 6’s launch, just like Warzone did after MW 2019, and we’re here to let you know if you can play for free, and if so, how.

Battlefield 6 launched with a campaign and multiplayer. Throw in Portal, and you’ve got yourself a pretty meaty bundle. However, we always knew EA and Battlefield Studios had more ideas up their sleeves. This materialized on October 28 with the launch of Battlefield 6’s REDSEC.

It came bundled with battle royale (no Solo mode, though) and the hot new Gauntlet playlist. Let’s see if you need Battlefield 6 to play it, though.

Can You Play REDSEC Without Owning Battlefield 6?

Yes, you can play Battlefield: REDSEC for free without needing to own a full, paid copy of Battlefield 6.

Just like Call of Duty and Warzone, REDSEC is an independent release separate from Battlefield 6. This means you can enjoy a premium Battlefield 6 experience without needing to pay a single penny.

All BR modes are free-to-play, as is Gauntlet Mode. We’re sure REDSEC will add new features and modes over the coming months and years as well. Has there ever been a better time to be a Battlefield fan?

How To Play Battlefield REDSEC

To play Battlefield REDSEC, you need to go into your relevant storefront, download it, wait for it to install, and you can jump straight into EA’s free-to-play Battlefield experience.

For an easy breakdown of what to do, check out these simple instructions:

  1. Go to the PlayStation Store, Microsoft Store, or Steam.
  2. Search for Battlefield REDSEC.
  3. Click on the game.
  4. Choose to download Battlefield REDSEC.
  5. Wait for the download to complete.
  6. Once it’s ready, you can now boot up REDSEC and play it for free!

There was speculation that REDSEC was going to be free, but only for players who already own Battlefield 6—technically making it not free. However, this is a smart decision on EA’s part and should do a lot to help both Battlefield 6 and REDSEC have a long battery life.

Let us know if you’ve had a chance to play REDSEC yet. Can you not get enough of Gauntlet? Or is the allure of battle royale still proving to be too much? Leave a comment and check out the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

We have more Battlefield 6 and REDSEC guides to read up on: How to Get A Free Battlefield 6 REDSEC Battle Royale Rogue Ops Pack, the Complete REDSEC DLC Trophy List, and How to Redeploy Teammates.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1594: Hints And Answer For October 30, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Get ready for an easier Wordle answer than the past few days. Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1594 for October 30, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, October 30, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1594 ups the difficulty just a bit from Wednesday’s puzzle. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4 guesses out of 6 to get. That means it’s slightly higher than the 3.8-guess average on October 29.

General Wordle Hints For October 30

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The word contains two vowels.
  • Hint 2: It includes both L and H.
  • Hint 3: It’s a machine used in woodworking and metalworking.
  • Hint 4: It spins a piece of stock so you can shape it into bowls, spindles, or shafts.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1594 for October 30, 2025

Starter Words For October 30, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • EARTH
  • PLATE
  • ALERT

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1594 On October 30, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: LATHE

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1593 on October 29, 2025:

Answer: GLARE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1594?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on October 31 will be Wordle Game #1595.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game tasks players with guessing a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket B1 Mega Rising—Release Date & Start Time, Confirmed Cards List
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon TCG Pocket is in the midst of its one-year anniversary celebrations, and a new set is right around the corner in Mega Rising, for which we have all the release date and start time details.

New sets in Pokémon TCG Pocket have been a regular occurrence since the title first released, but Mega Rising is a big moment for the title as it introduces the mechanic of Mega Evolution, adding further complexity to deck building to consider.

For all the release details of the Mega Rising set, check out our guide below.

Pokémon TCG Pocket B1 Mega Rising Release Date

TCG Pocket’s B1 Mega Rising set will be released on Thursday, October 30, as confirmed by the trailer for the new set.

The launch of the set marks the start of the second year of Pokémon TCG Pocket with the start of ‘B’ sets, though it’s not clear at this stage exactly how that will shake up the meta and what restrictions, if any, will be in place for cards.

There’s still time to get your hands on Pack Hourglasses ahead of the release of the set, and it’s worth taking every opportunity you can ahead of the release.

Pokémon TCG Pocket B1 Mega Rising Start Times

The B1 Mega Rising set will be available in the game from 11 PM PT on October 29, with a release on October 30 for the majority of the world.

The table below shows the exact release time and date for major time zones across the world.

Pokémon TCG Pocket B1 Mega Rising Confirmed Cards List

The Mega Rising set in Pokémon TCG Pocket is headlined by the introduction of Mega Evolutions, following the release of Pokémon Legends: Z-A and Mega Evolutions returning in the physical TCG.

Ahead of release, the full set list has been detailed by Serebii, featuring Mega Pinsir, Mega Blaziken, Mega Gyarados, and Mega Altaria amongst the cards. In total, there are 331 cards in the set—broken down into 226 normal cards and 105 Secret Rares.

The set will be split into three booster packs, like Genetic Apex was in the initial release of the game.

What Pokémon do you want to see added to Pokémon TCG Pocket? Let us know your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Forum.

For more Pokémon, read about the leak of a playable prototype for Pokopia, and check out all the details for Season 2 in Pokémon Legends: Z-A Ranked.
